item.title: Customer Relationship Groups in Marketing
item.dc:creator: Jamil
item.description: Customers can be classified into four groups according to profits obtained from them and loyalty.These four relationship groups are Butterflies, True-Friends, Strangers, and Barnacles. Strangers: They are the least profitable and the least loyal customers. Their needs and wants donâ€™talign with the market offerings. As a result, they generate the least profits and are labeled… Read More »Customer Relationship Groups in Marketing
item.content:encoded:
Customers can be classified into four groups according to profits obtained from them and loyalty.
These four relationship groups are Butterflies, True-Friends, Strangers, and Barnacles.

  • Strangers: They are the least profitable and the least loyal customers. Their needs and wants donâ€™t
    align with the market offerings. As a result, they generate the least profits and are labeled as short-
    term customers.
  • Butterflies: They are better than strangers as they are highly profitable. The downside of Butterflies
    is that they are not loyal and don’t stick with the same company. Only their needs fit the companyâ€™s
    offering but they are gone after a while. Companies capture value from them as long as they can. It
    is difficult to build a strong customer relationship with them.
  • Barnacles: They are very loyal and are said to be long-term customers. However, they are not very profitable. Their wants partially fit the companyâ€™s market offering. As a result, a large part of the companyâ€™s products is not bought by these customers.
  • True-Friends: They are the best kind of customer. True friends are highly profitable and loyal. Their wants are very compatible with the companyâ€™s offering and they stick with the company for a long time. They frequently purchase products from the same company and spread the positive word- of-mouth & experiences with others.

item.title: What is Marketing? Why is it important?
item.dc:creator: Jamil
item.description: The term â€œMarketingâ€ is very popular in the world of business. Every business requires marketing in order to let customers know about the offered products & the services. But is it a one-way relationship where the business only shows what they have to offer to the customer? Thereâ€™s much more to marketing than just showcasing… Read More »What is Marketing? Why is it important?
item.content:encoded:
The term â€œMarketingâ€ is very popular in the world of business. Every business requires marketing in order to let customers know about the offered products & the services. But is it a one-way relationship where the business only shows what they have to offer to the customer? Thereâ€™s much more to marketing than just showcasing products.

In simpler terms, Marketing is managing profitable customer relationships. The keyword here is â€œrelationshipâ€. A profitable customer relationship maintains an exchange process where the customer is getting a service or a product and the business is getting profits in return. But how does marketing manage a profitable customer relationship?

Â 

Through Marketing, companies create value for customers by making them interested in the companyâ€™s product or service and build a strong customer relationship in order to gain loyalty and satisfaction in return. As a result, in the long run, these loyal customers will secure a stream of purchases.

MarketingÂ
